Question/Recommendation:  added NXM (probably by adding the contract address) to 1inch but then realized that NXM (the *unwrapped* version) only has liquidity on NexusMutual's native dapp. I think it would be great, even for tokens similar to NXM, **to have a caution/warning modal that notifies the user that they will find NO liquidity**, or **restrict trading on such tokens**.
 Having either of these on the UI side would help users with less knowledge about tokens they're holding
(<@!594174776679858196> <@!337604738763849741> can also put this into a GitHub issue, if that's easier)

Here is a list of 1inch bounties:

1. Leverage on AAVE using Flashloan and 1inch swap ($3,000 in 1INCH tokens):
    - Example of 3x ETH over USDC long position leverage. Convert user's $1k USDC into $3k ETH collateral and $2k USDC debt. Can be assembled in single transaction:
        1. Get $2k USDC Flashloan
        2. Convert it to ETH using 1inch API
        3. Put $3k USDC as collateral to AAVE
        4. Borrow $2k USDC from AAVE
        5. Repay Flashloan with $2k USDC


2. AAVE liquidation protection bot ($3,000 in 1INCH tokens):
    - Track cost of collateral and debt using Chainlink. When PnL reaching user-defined boundaries (stop-loss and take-profit). Can be assembled in single transaction:
      1. Get Flashloan eqaul to debt
      2. Repay user debt
      3. Swap user's collateral to debt using 1inch API
      4. Repay Flashloan

3. Create long and short synths for $1INCH token using UMA Protocol ($1,000 in 1INCH tokens)

4. Open track ($1,000 in 1INCH tokens)
    - Surprise us! ‡ºº òÃöŸÑÕú òÃö‡ºΩ
    - Just BUIDL on top of 1inch whatever you want!

My questions are 1) This is just as simple as using 1inch to swap from one interest bearing token to another, right? 2) Are there any slippage or other risks in swapping I should disclose to my users, and how might I quantify that for them? 3) The main purpose of this is so that users can swap to the token producing the most yield at any time, but is there some kind of token one can hold that will automatically do this for them?

Hello 1INCH Team!
I am Aniket, participating in MarketMake. I'd just graduated from Indian Institute of Technology Jodhpur and I am on a journey to master web3 dev. I am very inspired by your journey as to how a project can go from ETH New York to being a real-world product with such a high trading volume.
I found the 1Inch bounties for Market make to be interesting. Particularly the liquidation bot bounty. I feel this bot would have great utility to a regular user of defi and would also help me master working with multiple protocols at once.
I am not an experienced web3 dev, and would rate myself as 6 out of 10. Hence, I would really appreciate your help as to how should I go about developing this bot? What resources would you suggest I look into at the start? Let me know if I can DM someone in order to get guidance related to this...
yes, you can. You need to set fromAddress to your contract address and set disableEstimate=true
https://docs.1inch.exchange/api/

Implementing on 1inch seems very much possible, but aavetomation has very similar functionality. Not really clear what the difference would be.

disableEstimate=true

There is not. you'll have to make sure the estimated return amount - slippage % is > 1 ETH 
(Since aggregating in reverse is difficult for non-AMM liquidity sources)

Hey everyone! üëã 

Just wanted to drop a quick intro & overview for 1inch!

üëÄ **About**
**The 1inch Network** unites decentralized protocols whose synergy enables the most lucrative, fastest and protected operations in the DeFi space.

The initial protocol of the 1inch Network is a DEX aggregator solution that searches deals across multiple liquidity sources, offering users better rates than any individual exchange. This protocol incorporates the Pathfinder algorithm which finds the best paths among different markets over more than 49 liquidity sources on Ethereum and 12 liquidity sources on Binance Smart Chain. In less than two years the 1inch DEX aggregator surpassed $30B in overall volume.

The 1inch Aggregation Protocol facilitates cost-efficient and secure swap transactions across multiple liquidity sources.

The 1inch Liquidity Protocol is a next-generation automated market maker that protects users from front-running attacks and offers attractive opportunities to liquidity providers.

üèÜ **Prize Overview**
**1inch Network will award 5,000 USD in 1INCH:**

**Mesh network using Web RTC for exchange of limit orders of different protocols**

- ***First place:*** 2,500 USD in 1INCH
- ***Runner-up:*** 1,500 USD in 1INCH

**Open track**

- ***One prize for the most innovative project:*** 1,000 USD in 1INCH

**See more on Prizes here:** 
https://www.notion.so/ethglobal/Prizes-Scaling-Ethereum-1d3a6c2966dd4d8fa679d78890f2f8a6

üîó** Important Links**

**Documentation:**
https://api.1inch.exchange/swagger/binance/

https://api.1inch.exchange/swagger/ethereum/

https://docs.1inch.io/api/

**1Inch API:**
https://1inch.exchange/#/api

**Github:**
https://github.com/1inch/1inchProtocol

Hi <@!725825203896189040> ! Maybe you have a demo or presentation?

PnL Tracker -1inch¬†

Story
Since 2017 actively using multiple wallets to be able to invest in different cryptocurrencies like:¬†
¬†
-Abra-invest and earn an APY in your crypto deposits
-Coinbase wallet-earn interest
-Atomic wallet-staking
-Infinito wallet-deposits
-jaxx wallet- deposits

-1inch- start using it -how much you save from using the exchange aggregator 
¬†
Problem
To be able to track my PnL you have to do it manually in Excel. It‚Äôs completely a hassle and extremely a paint point. Indeed,¬†It's critical to understanding your transaction cost, yield farming, and add transparency.
¬†
¬†
Solution
Build the product through subgraph form graph sponsored is complete more seamlessness.
Emulate the dashboard of Bloomberg PnL which is the best investments platform and add extra features and indicators.
¬†
For instance:
If you already have a smart contract deployed in 1inch, bootstrapping a new subgraph from this contract can be a good way to get started.
The following command creates a subgraph that indexes all events of an existing contract.
¬†
Top Tree features of the PnL tracker:
1-Transaction costs
2-Incorporate yield farming¬†
3-Easily to import and copied for your tax returns.
¬†¬†
Unique Value Proposition
Transparency and a crystal clear understanding of your PnL in crypto investments.
¬†
¬†¬†
Call to action:
Let me know second thoughts, 1inch team.

Looking forward to building the cutting-edge PnL tracker in the blockchain technology space.
¬†
May the force be with you,
¬†
Joshua Eick

ahoy. does 1inch have a smart contract API?
Here's what I want to do: zap from one token into two tokens (and then into an LP)
I don't think the API supports two outputs
fwiw would be super cool if 1inch offered zaps - makes total sense with the routing protocol
"I want to deposit 100 matic into the sushi ibWBTC/WBTC LP pool... route me efficiently please"

Sadly only legacy.1inch.exchange supports zaps and on ETH only, and the lp tokens have to be uniswap LP tokens. 
But in theory someone could build a zap feature with the 1inch swap API and integrating the pools
yeah that's what I'm going to do for a specific pool for this hackathon, but it's a little tricky because the amounts needed of each token can change between calling your API
that's why I was wondering about a smart contract API where could do the requests as part of a transaction

there's no way to get a quote (or the swap data) on-chain directly üòï
Just the API for swaps
yeah I guess you don't really want onchain quotes anyway

there was this: https://github.com/1inch/1inchProtocol

but it is deprecated now and has some issues that will not ever be resolved.
does the onchain swap API need to know the route or does it figure it out?
are there docs for that somewhere?
the swap api call on the 1inch v3 router needs the route. it can't figure it out itself
ok - so then I think what I'm doing is probably the best solution...

we have a smart contract wallet so I get the two quotes and figure out how much is needed for both destination tokens, but then I do the swap/swap/deposit all in a single transaction and if that fails I can re-quote
and it's on polygon so I don't really care about gas üôÇ

```function swap(

Hey! the contract is not on github but it is on etherscan at the 1inch.eth ENS
you can pull the data similarly to how you would with javascript, I might be able to make a python example for you
I was able to find a lightweight API wrapper in another github repo that I'm working off of, this should work for now

got it -- https://etherscan.io/address/0x1111111254fb6c44bac0bed2854e76f90643097d#code -- the swap interface here is different than in the docs:
```    function swap(
        IAggregationExecutor caller,
        SwapDescription calldata desc,
        bytes calldata data
    )
        external
        payable
        returns (
            uint256 returnAmount,
            uint256 spentAmount,
            uint256 gasLeft
        )```
Is the one on Etherscan the one to use then?
cc <@243162625007943681> thanks for the help!
I do see they're slightly different but the input parameters are the same, the output parameters seem to be slightly different
yeah

stETH: https://api.1inch.io/v5.2/1/swap?amount=1000000&src=0xEeeeeEeeeEeEeeEeEeEeeEEEeeeeEeeeeeeeEEeE&dst=0xae7ab96520de3a18e5e111b5eaab095312d7fe84&from=0x24509E1F87eDD8fC7c00f0738f45bC70aCe8BD4B&slippage=0.5&disableEstimate=true&receiver=0x62450f4067C79EfdBF2ABd5ae6F089d81cd6672d

rETH: https://api.1inch.io/v5.2/1/swap?amount=1000000&src=0xEeeeeEeeeEeEeeEeEeEeeEEEeeeeEeeeeeeeEEeE&dst=0x6b175474e89094c44da98b954eedeac495271d0f&from=0x24509E1F87eDD8fC7c00f0738f45bC70aCe8BD4B&slippage=0.5&disableEstimate=true&receiver=0x62450f4067C79EfdBF2ABd5ae6F089d81cd6672d

I'm decoding the calldata before calling the swap on your router contract to know how much to transfer (SwapDescription.amount)

`(,IPool.SwapDescription memory desc) = abi.decode(swapData[i][4:], (address, IPool.SwapDescription));`
swapData[0] = stETH -> succeeds decoding
swapData[1] = rETH -> fails decoding

The rETH one is much shorter. I've tried ETH->DAI and it's also very short. Not sure why it has different structure. Do you know?

üëã  sorry for the delay in response. 
if you'll notice the rETH function selector is different 0xf78dc253
if you want to **force** the function selector 0x12aa3caf then you'll need to use compatibility mode = true. I think it might just be `compatibility` now with v5.2 API though
the function in the rETH swap is `unoswapTo` which means there is a specific destination address *and* the only liquidity pools in use is uniswap v2 like pools

1inch fusion doesn't have the user do any routing, it's the resolvers that do the routing. Likely it's off-chain but it could be on-chain, like if they referenced a uniswap quoter or something üòÑ 

the fusion contracts just allow-list certain resolvers contracts, or workers
